page.title: 08Leatherhead Sewage Works
page.content: Mr.Parsons who works at Thames Water Authority today came to talk to us about Leatherhead Sewage Works.The modern sewage works was built in 1977 and is an activated sludge sewer.It covers Ashtead,Stoke D'abernon,Fetcham ,Great Bookham and Little Bookham and of course Leatherhead. Sludge is ploughed into farmland and the liquid left called effluent goes into the River Mole at Leatherhead and then goes through a Purification plant at Walton on Thames which cleans the water and comes back to our homes. The daily flow of sewage from the area is 2530000 gallons or 11500 cubic metres.
